summary: This is a New York City Police Department (NYPD) report documenting the death of Jeffrey Epstein at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in Manhattan. It records the initial notification, circumstances, and investigative assignment related to a 'possible hanging'.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found deceased in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in Manhattan. The circumstances were reported as a 'possible hanging' and the cause was initially listed as 'undetermined'.

events.title: NYPD Investigation Opened
events.description: The NYPD was notified and assigned an investigation (Case #N1-19-019432) into the death of Jeffrey Epstein at the MCC.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), 150 Park Row, Manhattan, New York, NY 10038
New York Presbyterian Lower Manhattan Hospital
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein died on August 10, 2019, at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in Manhattan.
The NYPD report lists the circumstances of death as a 'possible hanging' and the official cause as 'undetermined'.
Epstein was 66 years old at the time of his death, with a date of birth listed as 01/20/1953.
The NYPD opened an investigation into the death, assigned case number N1-19-019432.
Epstein was transported to New York Presbyterian Lower Manhattan Hospital, where he was pronounced dead.
